intro: Chaenorhinum macropodum, commonly known as the large-footed horned poppy, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, bright orange to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a rough texture. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, aiding in its dispersal.
